issue.title: [ENH][BUG] Testing vectorization for forecasters, plus various bugfixes

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This PR contains a simple test for vectorization via `BaseForecaster`.

This PR also contains the following change:
* relaxes the `pd-multiindex` mtype so the multiindex levels do not need to have particular names (from `"instances"` and `"timepoints"`)

A number of bugs were uncovered, these were fixed:
* the `_nested_dataframe_has_nans` utility function did not work for nested data frames where index was not integer starting at zero - fixed replacing `loc` indexing by `iloc`. Relies on PR #2216 where this is separated out.
* a number of bugs around vectorization in `BaseForecaster` - it did not actually work.

FYI @TonyBagnall about the first bug - I think you have seen it before?
FYI @danbartl about the second bug. Vectorization now works as intended, at least for `Panel` input. Will add the `Hierarchical` test once @ltsaprounis's data generator is merged.

body:
suspicion: `get_cutoff(_make_hierarchical())`, for some reason, results in a time stamp without the `freq` attribute. Why, and why specifically on windows? On my local system, the `freq` attribute is not lost.

Any good ideas, @ltsaprounis?
Might be a data types issue, I'll look into it!

issue.title: Dummy PR for hierarchical forecast tests

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
Dummy PR to test issue #2194
Added some logging to see whether the issue comes from the pandas dtypes in `_make_hierarchical`
Tests pass locally on Mac & python 3.8

issue.title: Fix windows bug with index freq in VetorizedDF.__getitem__

labels.name: bugfix
labels.description: Fixes a known bug or removes unintended behavior

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing a pull request! Please ensure you have taken a look
at our contribution guide: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

#### Reference Issues/PRs
<!--
Example: Fixes #1234. See also #3456.

Please use keywords (e.g., Fixes) to create link to the issues or pull requests
you resolved, so that they will automatically be closed when your pull request
is merged. See https://github.com/blog/1506-closing-issues-via-pull-requests
-->
Fixes #2194 

#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you have implemented.
-->
After a lot of debugging in #2224, I found that the tests are failing for Windows because the series obtained when looping through `VetorizedDF` have frequency `None` in Windows and `"D"` for both Linux and Mac. The fix is to  add a new function that uses `pd.infer_freq` to update the frequency of each series in `VetorizedDF.__getitem__`.

#### PR checklist
<!--
Please go through the checklist below. Please feel free to remove points if they are not applicable.
-->

##### For all contributions
- [X] I've added unit tests and made sure they pass locally.

<!--
Thanks for contributing!
-->
